message.div:
Hi Sid!
My name is Sam Stites â€”Â I work at a sub-branch of Roche Sequencing Solutions out of San Francisco where we are trying to solve cancer. My girlfriend and I are looking to work remotely out of Barcelona for 11 days and were wondering if we could rent your apartment for the dates attached.
It seems like you are right in the middle of everything which is must be amazing! We are probably just looking to hole up in coffeeshops to work off of the wifi during the day, while going walking/urban exploring during the night.
I noticed that you occasionally rent the entire flat â€”Â would it be possible in April? If so, could you also give us some advice for some quiet spots to work?
Thanks and Happy Holidays!
-Sam

div.span: hmmmmmm delete the first part about roche
also you can link to my profile

message.div:

Thanks for checking out my listing. I'd love to know:
â€¢ Where are you from?
â€¢ What brings you to Barcelona? Who's joining you?
â€¢ Would you like to know more about the neighborhood?

i just figure that, being more specific gives more of a backdrop.

div.span: also i gotta tell you "solve cancer" sounds strange

message.div:
Hi Sid!
My name is Sam Stites â€”Â I work as an engineer in San Francisco at Roche Sequencing Solutions and will be traveling from March 27th to April 19th with my girlfriend. Both of us are looking to work remotely out of Barcelona for the last 11 days and were wondering if we could rent your apartment for that time.

div.span: My girlfriend, Anastasia (https://www.airbnb.com/users/show/3977970) and I, both computer engineers living in San Francisco, CA, are going to be traveling to Barcelona for 11 days to try to see a bit of the world while we work full-time, abroad.
We plan to spend our days holed up in coffeeshops and public libraries doing work, and running around exploring the streets of the city at night.
I noticed that you occasionally rent the entire flat â€”Â would it be possible rent it in April for the 11 days specified?
i think at the least it's worth to link to my profile
i have one review and i'm a "real person" by having been verified
oops, no need to say 11 days twice

My girlfriend, Anastasia (https://www.airbnb.com/users/show/3977970) and I, both computer engineers living in San Francisco, CA, are going to be traveling to Barcelona to try to see a bit of the world while we work full-time, abroad.
We plan to spend our days holed up in coffeeshops and public libraries doing work, and run around exploring the streets of the city in the evenings.
I noticed that you occasionally rent the entire flat â€”Â would it be possible rent it in April for the 11 days specified?

message.div:
Hi Sid!
My name is Sam Stites.
My girlfriend, Anastasia (https://www.airbnb.com/users/show/3977970) and I, are software engineers living in San Francisco, CA and will be traveling to Barcelona for 11 days to see a bit of the world as we work full-time, abroad.
We plan to spend our days holed up in coffeeshops and public libraries for work, while running around exploring the streets of Barcelona at night.
I noticed that you occasionally rent the entire flat â€” would that be possible to do from the 8th to the 19th of April?
Thanks and Happy Holidays!
-Sam

After hours of standing in a bread line
a young man suddenly throws up his hands and shouts, "Enough! I've had it! I'm going to go kill Gorbachev!!"
he returns to the line he was in
"What happened?" the other people in line ask.
"I thought you were going to kill Gorbachev!"
"That line was even longer," he says.

The KGB, the FBI and the CIA are all trying to prove that they are the best at catching criminals.Â The Secretary General of the UN decides to give them a test. He releasesÂ a rabbit into a forest and each of them has to catch it.
The CIA goesÂ in. They place animal informants throughout the forest. They questionÂ all plant and mineral witnesses. After three months of extensiveÂ investigations they conclude that the rabbit does not exist.
The FBI goes in. After two weeks with no leads they burn the forest,Â killing everything in it, including the rabbit, and make no apologies:Â the rabbit had it coming.
The KGB goes in. They come out two hours laterÂ with a badly beaten bear. The bear is yelling: "Okay! Okay! I'm aÂ rabbit! I'm a rabbit!"

div.span: except that doesn't stand the test of time
cia would have done the same
